question.text: Read the given statements carefully and identify the wrong one.

options.text: All plants have PGA as the first product of CO<sub>2</sub> fixation.
Within the chloroplast, protons in the stroma decrease in number, while in the lumen of thylakoid, there is accumulation of protons.
Stroma lamellae membranes lack PS-II as well as NADP reductase enzyme.
Carotenoids protect chlorophyll a from photo-oxidation.

solution.text: PGA as the first product of carbon dioxide fixation is found only in C<sub>3</sub> plants. It C<sub>4 </sub>plants it is oxaloacetic acid. Within the chloroplast, protons in the stroma decrease in number, while in the lumen of thylakoid, there is an accumulation of protons. Stroma lamellae membranes lack PS-II as well as NADP reductase enzyme. Carotenoids protect chlorophyll a from photo-oxidation.
